metadata.title: CVE-2024-9398 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
By checking the result of calls to `window.open` with specifically setprotocol handlers, an attacker could determine if the application whichimplements that protocol handler is installed. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 131, Firefox ESR < 128.3, Thunderbird < 128.3, and Thunderbird <131.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-9398` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 131.0+build1.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 131.0+build1.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 131.0+build1.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '131.0+build1.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
